title: A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To The Moon..  XviD
description:
Hi there..

I'm at the moment being constantly monitored and hindered in sharing Christian material. For instance uTorrent shows that there's three(!) seeders on every torrent I upload when they've been published for a few minutes, and I have shared maybe 1% of the file. How's that possible? A month ago it showed "only" two..

The people who hate what I do block my listening port and slows down my bandwidth to an extreme low, and I'm being bombarded in comments on uploads and mails. The only thing I can do, is to appeal to you who are Christians, to help me seed these torrents, because I don't know how much longer I'm able to do this. Not for long, I fear. And I live in Norway, a so called "free Nation" of the western world..
And then I'm accused of being a "conspiracy-theorist".. :-)

Well. About this upload: The masters of this game called "Ruling The World", have always been more concerned about appearances than being truthful. We have seen this over and over, so the content of this movie should not come as a surprise.

You may find it incredible that you should have been lied to on such a massive scale, but that is not why this movie is important, but rather because: If they lied about this, then what else have they lied about through the years?

When I found this movie, the original uploader said in his comment something like: "If you really want to believe that mankind landed a man on the moon in 1969, then don't watch this. I don't want to make you upset. But if you are a genuine truth-seeker, I hope you will find this movie useful."

I kind of like the X-files slogan: "The truth is out there", but actually I'd like to say: "The truth is in your face". Just open your eyes.

And please: Don't despair, don't give up, and remember the One who said: "I am the Way, the Truth and the Life". That was of course Jesus of Nazareth, and I have found Him to be the Only One potent to ease my worried mind in the midst of the storm. He'll replace wrong with right very soon now.

Arnold Schwarzenegger wasn't the first one to say "I'll be back".
That was Jesus of Nazareth, and He meant it..
I'll believe Him over Arnold. Won't you? :-)
